baby back ribs: each rib has a bone with meat attached
the meat is usually covered in barbecue sauce
baklava: made of layers of filo dough
filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey
usually cut into diamond or square shapes
served as a dessert or snack
beef tartare: often with egg, capers, and onions
may be garnished with herbs or spices
beet salad: a bowl or plate of food
other salad ingredients like croutons, cheese, or dressing
bibimbap: topped with vegetables, meat, and/or an egg
often served with gochujang (red chili pepper paste)
can be served with kimchi on the side
bread pudding: made with bread or a bread-like product
typically contains eggs, milk, sugar, and spices
often served with a sauce or topping
bruschetta: topped with olive oil, garlic, and tomatoes
caesar salad: a salad made with romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing
caprese salad: a salad made of tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil
ceviche: typically includes fish, shrimp, and/or squid
served with onions, peppers, and cilantro
may be garnished with avocado, lime, and/or chili peppers
cheese plate: a plate with several different kinds of cheese
a variety of crackers or bread
a knife for cutting the cheese
a spreader for spreading the cheese
cheesecake: usually has a graham cracker or cookie crust
can be topped with fruit, whipped cream, or chocolate
may have a design on top made with icing or chocolate
chicken curry: a bowl or plate of food
curry is usually a yellow, orange, or red color
chicken wings: served with celery and blue cheese dressing
chocolate mousse: a chocolate mousse is a dessert made from chocolate, eggs, and cream,
it is usually served in a glass or cup,
it may have a whipped cream topping,
it may be garnished with chocolate shavings or a cherry.
clam chowder: usually contains potatoes, onions, and celery
typically contains clams, bacon, and/or seafood
may be garnished with parsley, thyme, or other herbs
club sandwich: a sandwich with multiple layers of meat, cheese, and vegetables
bread that is toasted or grilled
crab cakes: a cake or patty made of crab meat
may be served with a sauce or dressing
may be garnished with vegetables or herbs
croque madame: a sandwich made of bread, ham, and cheese
the bread is usually toasted or grilled
a fried or poached egg is placed on top
garnished with parsley or other herbs
cup cakes: sprinkles or other decorations on top
a paper or plastic cupcake liner
dumplings: small, round, and filled with meat or vegetables
can be made with different fillings
edamame: a pod with small, green beans inside
a stem attached to the pod
a plant with a woody stem
a plant that is a member of the pea family
eggs benedict: a dish composed of an English muffin, ham, a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce
the egg is usually cooked so that the yolk is runny
may be garnished with parsley, paprika, or other herbs
falafel: made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both
usually served in a pita or wrap
topped with salads, pickles, and sauces
filet mignon: can be grilled, pan-fried, or roasted
typically served with a sauce or vegetables
foie gras: made from the liver of a duck or goose
can be served as a pate or mousse
often served with a sweet or savory sauce
may be garnished with fruit, nuts, or herbs
french onion soup: a spoon for eating the soup
french toast: bread that has been soaked in egg and milk
often served with butter, syrup, or fruit
fried rice: a dish made of rice that has been stir-fried in a wok or a frying pan
can be made with various ingredients like meats, vegetables, and eggs
usually has a brown or yellowish color
can be served with soy sauce, chili sauce, or other condiments
frozen yogurt: a cup or cone of frozen yogurt
toppings such as fruits, nuts, or candy
garlic bread: often with parsley or other herbs
gnocchi: made from potato, flour, and egg
can be boiled, baked, or fried
greek salad: a mix of greens, such as lettuce, spinach, and arugula
grilled cheese sandwich: cheese melted in between the slices of bread
grilled salmon: may be served with lemon, butter, or other sauces
guacamole: a green, brown, or black color
made from avocados, onions, tomatoes, and other ingredients
often served with chips, tacos, or burritos
gyoza: made of wheat flour dough and filled with meat and vegetables
usually served steamed, boiled, or fried
can be served with dipping sauce
hamburger: lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, cheese, and/or other condiments
hot and sour soup: chunks of vegetables or meat in the soup
a spoon for eating the soup
huevos rancheros: a dish typically consisting of a fried egg, a tortilla, and beans
can also include cheese, avocado, salsa, and sour cream
the egg is usually sunny side up or over easy
hummus: made from chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, and lemon juice
can be flavored with garlic, cumin, paprika, or other spices
typically served with pita bread, vegetables, or crackers
can be used as a dip or spread
ice cream: made from milk, cream, and sugar
can be flavored with fruit, nuts, chocolate, or other ingredients
lasagna: multiple layers of pasta, sauce, and cheese
typically red or brown in color
lobster bisque: a garnish of green onions or parsley
a dollop of sour cream or crème fraiche
lobster roll sandwich: a sandwich with a lobster tail and claw meat filling
mayonnaise, celery, and lemon juice often added to the filling
can be served cold or hot
macaroni and cheese: a bowl or dish of food
macarons: made of two discs of almond meringue with a filling in between
the filling is usually flavored with chocolate, coffee, lemon, or raspberry
the cookies are often brightly colored
they are usually served in pairs
miso soup: a light brown or tan color
nachos: with various toppings such as meat, vegetables, and sauce
omelette: usually made with eggs, milk, and butter
can include other ingredients like cheese, ham, or vegetables
typically served for breakfast or brunch
can be made in a variety of shapes and sizes
can be served with a variety of toppings
pad thai: a type of Asian noodle dish
noodles are usually made from rice, wheat, or egg
can be stir-fried, boiled, or served in a soup
often contains vegetables, protein, and a sauce
may be garnished with peanuts, cilantro, lime, and bean sprouts
paella: typically made of metal or ceramic
food is cooked and served in the same dish
typically has rice, seafood, and vegetables
can be made in different colors, depending on the ingredients used
pancakes: each pancake is round and flat
pancakes are usually served with syrup, butter, and/or fruit
panna cotta: a dessert made with cream and gelatin
typically served in a small, round dish
can be decorated with fruit, sauce, or other toppings
can be made in a variety of flavors
peking duck: a waterfowl with a long neck and small head
a reddish-brown plumage with a white chest and belly
a black cap on the head
pho: a type of Vietnamese noodle soup
typically made with beef or chicken broth
served with a side of hoisin and Sriracha sauce
pizza: toppings, such as cheese, vegetables, and meat
a circumference of crust that is thicker than the rest of the pizza
pork chop: may be grilled, baked, or fried
served with a side of vegetables or rice
prime rib: a large, roasted piece of meat
typically served on a platter with vegetables
the meat is usually pink or red in the center, with a layer of fat on top
the meat is surrounded by a bone
pulled pork sandwich: a sandwich with a filling of pulled pork
the pork is usually cooked with barbecue sauce
the sandwich may also include coleslaw or other toppings
the sandwich is usually served on a bun or roll
ravioli: filled with meat, cheese, or vegetables
served with a fork and knife
risotto: can be made with various ingredients like vegetables, meats, or seafood
often served as a main course
can be garnished with cheese, herbs, or lemon
sashimi: often served with soy sauce and wasabi
can be made with salmon, tuna, or other fish
may be garnished with ginger, daikon, or other vegetables
scallops: a soft body with frills around the edge
a muscular foot used for locomotion and feeding
seaweed salad: a mix of green, brown, and red seaweed
served in a bowl or on a plate
often with soy sauce or vinegar
shrimp and grits: a bowl or plate of food
spaghetti bolognese: a bowl or plate of spaghetti noodles
a red or brown meat sauce
shredded or grated cheese on top
spaghetti carbonara: can be made with other types of pasta
a sauce made with eggs, cheese, and bacon
can also include onion, garlic, and black pepper
served with a sprinkle of parsley
strawberry shortcake: a cake or biscuit with strawberries and cream
sushi: sushi is typically made with raw fish, seafood, or vegetables
sushi is often served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger
sushi is typically rolled in nori (seaweed)
sushi can be served in a variety of ways, including nigiri (sliced fish on top of rice), maki (rolled sushi), and temaki (hand-rolled sushi)
tacos: a soft or hard taco shell
takoyaki: a small, round ball of batter
filled with octopus, vegetables, and/or other ingredients
served with a sauce and/or other toppings
on a skewer or in a small, round container
